title: Syria Conducted Chlorine Attack in May, U.S. Says
summary: The incident would mark the first confirmed violation of chemical-weapons accord since a 2018 U.S. military strike on Syria over its alleged poison-gas use. Syrian government forces carried out a chlorine attack in May, the first confirmed violation of the international accord banning chemical weapons since President Trump authorized a U.S. military strike on Syria in 2018 over its alleged use of poison gas, a new U.S. intelligence assessment says.

title: Pelosi Ducks an Impeachment Vote
summary: The full House authorized inquiries for Nixon and Clinton. Why not for Trump?. Democrats and a cheerleading press corps are accelerating their drive to impeach President Trump, with the release Thursday of the whistleblower complaint and a harangue of the acting director of national intelligence. Not to spoil the fun, but when is the House going to hold a roll call vote to authorize this effort to oust an elected President?

title: Delta Air Lines to Take 20% Stake in Latam Airlines
summary: American had previously sought to partner with Latam. Delta Air Lines Inc. is taking a stake in South America's biggest airline, winning out over rival American Airlines Group Inc., which had also sought to work through that carrier to deepen its presence in Latin America.

title: Everyone In Washington Is Reading the Whistleblower Complaint - Except Senate Republicans
summary: The document dominating the news Thursday was still unknown to many GOP lawmakers. A nine-page whistleblower complaint might have been the most-read document in Washington on Thursday-but not among Senate Republicans.

title: Comptroller Blasts New York City Over Lead-Inspection Failures
summary: 'Government complacency may have allowed thousands of our precious children to get hurt,' says Scott Stringer. New York City agencies charged with preventing lead poisoning in children didn't always go far enough to share information that would trigger in-home inspections for possible lead exposure, according to a report by Comptroller Scott Stringer.

title: Latin America vs. Maduro
summary: Fifteen Latin nations join the U.S. to invoke a rare treaty resolution.. Meanwhile, back in Venezuela, dictator Nicolás Maduro hangs onto power with the help of Cuban intelligence. His isolation was underscored this week when 15 Latin American countries joined the U.S. in a resolution to invoke the Rio Treaty against the Maduro regime.

title: Discount Retailer Fred's Strikes Deals to Sell More Pharmacy Assets
summary: Walgreens Boots Alliance, ExpressRx buying Fred's pharmacy assets for $16.4 million. Discount retailer Fred's Inc. has reached two separate deals to sell some of its pharmacy assets, including 10 drugstores and inventory, to Walgreens Boots Alliance Inc. and ExpressRx Co. for a total of about $16.4 million.

title: Boeing, Embraer Deal Faces EU Scrutiny
summary: European Commission expected to being an in-depth probe. European competition regulators are expected to open an in-depth probe into plans by Boeing Co. to take control of the commercial-jetliner arm of Brazil's Embraer SA in a move that could upset plans to close that deal by the end of the year.

title: Democrats Set a Bear Trap
summary: Pelosi thinks she has Trump's number. She may be right, though Biden won't escape this scandal.. Every time I imagine Elizabeth Warren debating Donald Trump, I picture him rumbling onto the stage like a big white bear-roaring "Grrr grrrr," towering over her, paws flailing, claws extended. She'll stand there looking up at him in the lights, and you'll wonder if she's trembling, cowering, because clearly she's about to be crushed. And then she'll take a brisk step forward and punch him hard and sharp in the kidney. And he'll howl-"Aarrrrggg!"-because he's surprised and it hurts and he assumed he'd easily chase her around the stage.

title: Endeavor Pulls IPO After Peloton's Poor Debut
summary: Entertainment company was expected to begin trading Friday; Peloton slides in first day of trading. The IPO market took another hit Thursday as Endeavor Group Holdings Inc. yanked its planned offering, and Peloton Interactive Inc.'s shares skidded on their first day of trading.

title: 'Poisoner in Chief' Review: Chemistry Lessons
summary: The CIA's mind-control experiments of the 1950s and '60s, some carried out on unwitting subjects, jeopardized the rights of U.S. citizens.. The general outlines of the story will be familiar to many readers: From 1953 to 1963, the CIA made a wild effort to develop techniques of mind control. The signature program, code-named MK-Ultra, included experiments on both witting and unwitting subjects, many of whom were given large doses of LSD. The program later branched out into poisons, which the CIA attempted, apparently at the White House's behest, unsuccessfully to use on some foreign leaders, notably Prime Minister Patrice Lumumba of Congo and Fidel Castro of Cuba. A series of articles by Seymour Hersh beginning in 1974 led to investigations by the White House and Congress, resulting in executive orders regulating the CIA and laws subjecting the agency to oversight by Senate and House intelligence committees.

title: Taking Out Joe Biden
summary: The left can impeach Trump and destroy an insufficiently liberal front-runner.. The Trump years have been rough on Democrats' sensibilities, and their thinking has become increasingly addled as a result. The party has worked tirelessly to create an issue worthy of impeaching the president-Russia collusion, obstruction of justice, Stormy Daniels, tax returns. This week Democrats jettisoned all that in favor of the only issue that implicates their own front-runner for the nomination. Genius.

title: Say Hallelujah and Pass the Remote
summary: Technology is now as much a part of worship as prayer books and hymnals.. Temple Israel, a reform synagogue in suburban Detroit, undertook a substantial renovation a few years ago. The makeover included a spruced-up atrium and social hall, new display cases, and the installation of two video screens flanking the pulpit.

title: Don't Help Russia Make It to the Moon
summary: In choosing a backup rocket provider, NASA should favor Musk over Moscow.. The National Aeronautics and Space Administration is working hard to achieve the Trump administration's goal of putting U.S. astronauts back on the moon by 2024. But the rush may end up benefiting Russia.

title: Why Did the Chicken Cross the Border?
summary: Efforts to start a culture war fizzle as Canadians line up for hours at the country's first Chick-fil-A.. Toronto

title: Colleges Go to Court Over a Donor's Intent
summary: Sherlock Hibbs's will gave Hillsdale the authority to monitor Mizzou's compliance with its terms.. The gift seemed too good to pass up: a $5 million bequest from a wealthy alumnus for the University of Missouri, endowing three chairs and three professorships in its business college. The condition was unusual, requiring each of the six to be a "dedicated and articulate disciple of the free and open market economy (the Ludwig von Mises Austrian School of Economics)." But after the donor, Sherlock Hibbs, died at 98 in 2002, Mizzou accepted. It shouldn't have.

title: PPG Settles Probe Into Accounting Errors Without a Fine
summary: Paint-and-coatings company had faced inquiries from SEC, U.S. attorneys. PPG Industries Inc. reached a settlement with the Securities and Exchange Commission to close an investigation into accounting irregularities at the paint-and-coatings maker without paying a fine.

title: British Politics Is Working Too Well
summary: Free states don't act on small majorities. They ask what voters really want and build broad support.. Conventional wisdom holds that the United Kingdom is in the throes of a messy political collapse as Brexit debates grind on and it becomes harder to tell who's in charge, let alone what's coming next. Conventional wisdom, as usual, is wrong. Britain's problem is that its political system is working too well.

title: Senate Passes Short-Term Spending Measure
summary: Stopgap bill would keep government open through Nov. 21 as lawmakers try to pass new annual spending legislation. WASHINGTON-The Senate passed a short-term funding measure to stave off a possible government shutdown after the end of the month, sending the legislation to President Trump's desk justdays before the end of the federal fiscal year on Sept. 30.

title: Trump's Pick to Head ATF Is in Jeopardy
summary: Chuck Canterbury of police union faces GOP concern on commitment to gun rights. The confirmation of President Trump's pick to head the U.S. Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives is in jeopardy as some Republican senators expressed concern that he would restrict the rights of gun owners, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Proceed With Caution on a Defense Pact With Israel
summary: A treaty looks attractive to both Washington and Jerusalem, but potential pitfalls remain.. For all their longstanding defense ties, Israel and the U.S. have no mutual defense treaty. In the weeks before Israel's Sept. 17 elections President Donald Trump and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu both spoke favorably of negotiating one. Whether they were serious or simply wanted to bolster Mr. Netanyahu's political support is unclear. In any case, a few observations are in order.

title: Intelligence Chief Joseph Maguire Defends Handling of Whistleblower Document
summary: Lawmakers press acting director of national intelligence over delay in turning over complaint about Trump's Ukraine phone call. WASHINGTON-Democrats pressed America's top intelligence official to explain his handling of a politically explosive whistleblower complaint, as lawmakers squared off in the first hearing related to President Trump's July phone call with his Ukrainian counterpart.

title: Wisconsin Marketing Company Pays Nearly $10 Million to Settle Foreign Bribery Charges
summary: Quad/Graphics made illicit payments in Peru and China to secure business, according to the U.S. securities regulator. Quad/Graphics Inc. has agreed to pay nearly $10 million to settle charges from the U.S. securities regulator that the print-and-digital marketing company violated foreign bribery laws.

title: GM, UAW Enter Final Stretch of Labor Talks
summary: Top bargainers move into late stages of talks as strike extends through 11th day. Contract talks between General Motors Co. and the United Auto Workers entered a critical stretch Thursday night, with bargainers focusing on big-picture issues such as wages, benefits and the use of temporary workers, according to people close to the talks.

title: Best-Selling Books Week Ended September 21
summary: With data from NPD BookScan.

title: AI Helps Jazz Up Presentations
summary: New tools from Microsoft, Cisco and others are aimed at making meetings livelier. Companies are turning to robot speech coaches and slideshow designers to give meetings more pizazz.

title: Prosecutors, Trump Lawyers Reach Temporary Deal Over Request for Tax Returns
summary: Prosecutors agree to not enforce subpoena for president's financial information, for now. New York state prosecutors and lawyers for President Trump told a federal judge Thursday that they had reached a deal to temporarily resolve their dispute over a subpoena for eight years of the president's tax returns.

title: Micron's Hard-Won Discipline Is Tested
summary: The memory-chip maker stays profitable in a slump, though its bottom line still swings hard. Micron Technology has proven it can stay profitable in a downturn. But its bottom line is proving still too volatile for some.

title: KPMG Moves U.K. Employees From Advisory to Audit Business
summary: The shuffle comes as U.K. regulators and lawmakers discuss a potential overhaul of the sector's structure. KPMG LLP is moving about 750 U.K. employees, including some partners, from its advisory business to its audit division to prepare for potential regulatory changes.

title: Dell CFO Leads Charge to Pay Down Debt Load
summary: Finance chief hopes delevering will boost computer maker's credit rating by fiscal 2021. Dell Technologies Inc. finance chief Tom Sweet is focusing on driving down a mountain of debt amid scrutiny from investors and analysts.

title: Putin Gains from Presidents' Exchange on Europe's Ukraine Policy
summary: 'We're smiling,' says pro-Kremlin analyst after Ukrainian president's remarks on EU are revealed. A phone conversation between President Trump and the president of Ukraine threatens to strain support for Kyiv in Western Europe and play into the hands of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: Homeless Advocates in New York to Resume 'Sleep Out' Demonstration
summary: Annual demonstration was suspended after mayor's election given his commitment to affordable housing. When Mayor Bill de Blasio was elected mayor in 2013, advocates for the homeless saw him as a leader who could bring meaningful change to New York City's affordable-housing crisis.

title: 'Judy': A Star Is Reborn
summary: Renée Zellweger shines as a late-career Judy Garland in Rupert Goold's film.. When Judy Garland makes her way on stage to sing one last song in "Judy," a young woman who's been assigned to keep her functioning for the run of the show says to the producer, "I don't think she can help it." Help what? The pills? The booze? The paralyzing anxiety? No, the singing. This wrecked legend, played with heart-stopping brilliance by Renée Zellweger, can't help singing, even though her voice is shot and her body has almost given out. It's a simple notion that cuts through layers of clichés to the musical quick. The movie, directed by Rupert Goold, is a conventional but perfectly serviceable showcase for its star, who sets the whole thing on fire every time she launches into a Garland classic in her own voice.

title: 'Abominable': Cute Creature, Great Look
summary: A trio of kids helps a youthful yeti return to its Himalayan home in this good-hearted fable.. 'Abominable" is anything but. An animated fable set in contemporary China and voiced in colloquial English, this Chinese-American co-production is so distinctive pictorially, and so manifestly good-hearted, that it's easy to forgive if not quite forget the ragged quality of its storyline.

title: McDonald's to Test Plant-Based Burger in Canada
summary: The 'P.L.T.,' for plant, lettuce and tomato, will be on sale at some restaurants in southwestern Ontario starting Monday. McDonald's Corp. is getting on the plant-based bandwagon.

title: WeWork's Parent Paid With Stock for Some Acquisitions, and Investors in Those Startups Aren't Happy
summary: Real-estate technology company used its highly valued stock as a way to fund some of its acquisitions. WeWork's parent went on a buying spree before its planned initial public offering, using its highly valued private shares to finance purchases of other venture-backed startups. Now, these startups and their investors are left holding shares that are likely worth a lot less than they bargained for.

title: U.S. Stocks Drop on Political Uncertainty
summary: Three defensive sectors in the S&P 500, consumer staples, real estate and utilities, rise. U.S. stocks fell Thursday after the release of a whistleblower complaint that has sparked an impeachment push against President Trump clouded the political outlook.

title: Washington Gives Exchange-Traded Funds Fast Lane to Market
summary: Wall Street gets relief for one of its faster-growing inventions. Wall Street on Thursday got relief for one of its faster-growing inventions, with regulators clearing a path for exchange-traded funds to be issued more easily.

title: Pay-TV Channel Starz Gets New President, CEO
summary: Jeffrey A. Hirsch played a lead role in integrating Starz into Lions Gate following its 2016 acquisition. Lions Gate Entertainment Corp. said it has named Jeffrey A. Hirsch as president and chief executive of its pay-TV channel Starz.

title: 'The Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia' Review: Fair Weather Friend?
summary: A 'Frontline' presentation takes a hard look at the de facto ruler of the oil-rich kingdom, Mohammed bin Salman.. The PBS investigative program "Frontline" begins its 38th season Tuesday with a murder story-though this one might also be called "Anatomy of a Police State." Given that Americans are likely en route to defend the state in question, calling the show a "must see" doesn't quite do it justice.

title: 'Now Hear This: The Riddle of Bach' Review: Genuflecting to a Musical God
summary: Violinist Scott Yoo dissects-and learns-the work of the great composer in this installment of the PBS miniseries.. Violinist Scott Yoo doesn't exactly gush when describing Johann Sebastian Bach. He does call him "the greatest composer of all time." And "the greatest musician of all time." He speculates whether the composer was "the smartest person who's ever lived." And, throwing caution to the musical and theological wind, he declares that "Bach is God." OK, maybe he gushes a little.

title: U.S. Tax Compliance Holds Flat at 86%
summary: IRS study finds persistent gap between taxes owed and collected. WASHINGTON-Americans pay about 86% of their federal taxes, leaving a $381 billion annual gap between taxes owed and taxes collected, according to an Internal Revenue Service study released Thursday.

title: Trump's Fed Attacks Are Helping to Drive Rate Cuts, Paper Says
summary: Resume Subscription. The Federal Reserve may be under President Trump's thumb more than central bank officials are willing to let on.

title: With Chips Down, Saudi Arabia Finds Fewer Friends in the U.S.
summary: Kingdom's image has been battered by war in Yemen, Khashoggi killing and continued skirmishing over Sept. 11 terrorist attacks. BEIRUT-In a moment of need, reeling from a devastating attack on key oil facilities, Saudi Arabia is finding few friends these days in Washington or across the U.S.

title: 'Caesar and Cleopatra' Review: Kitten Into Queen
summary: In David Staller's new adaptation of George Bernard Shaw's work, the worldly Caesar transforms a Lolita-like Cleopatra into a hardheaded political realist.. New York

title: Trade Concerns Push Up Treasurys
summary: Treasury yields fall after consumer-spending data were revised lower. U.S. government bonds gained Thursday after fresh signs that trade tensions could pressure economic growth.

title: 'The Height of the Storm' Review: Weathering It as Best They Can
summary: Veteran actors Eileen Atkins and Jonathan Pryce are in fine form, despite being given lackluster material, in Florian Zeller's play.. Old actors never die, they just start appearing in old-actor plays, of which there are two kinds: feel-good old-age-isn't-for-sissies weepers like "On Golden Pond" and harsh old-age-is-a-shipwreck dramas like "The Waverly Gallery." Florian Zeller's "The Height of the Storm," which has transferred to Broadway after a successful West End run, is a play of the first kind dressed up to look like a play of the second kind.

title: U.S. Sending Patriot Battery, 200 Troops to Saudi Arabia
summary: Deployment, which includes radar systems as well, follows Sept. 14 attacks on oil installations. WASHINGTON-The U.S. military will send an antimissile battery, radar systems and just over 200 additional U.S. service members to Saudi Arabia in response to the suspected Iranian attack this month against Saudi oil facilities, the Pentagon said.

title: Cruise Stocks Go on Sale After Yet Another Profit Warning
summary: Declines will test if investors' appetite for cheap stocks outweighs fear of slowing growth. Thursday's selloff in cruise operator stocks just made a beaten-down group even cheaper.

title: Dish, Fox Dispute Costs Viewers Access to Channels
summary: The two sides are battling over a new contract, and disagree about what caused the issue. Dish Network Corp. and Fox Corp. are battling over a new contract, and the dispute has resulted in consumers losing access to a number of cable channels and local stations carried by the satellite-television operator.

title: Run on Momentum Stocks Is Punishing a Surprising Group
summary: Payment processor stocks, not FAANG, are taking the brunt of September's selling. September has turned the strongest trades of the year on their heads, sparking a rare period of underperformance among many big technology stocks. But the shares that have taken the biggest hits aren't the usual suspects.

title: The U.N. General Assembly Tackles Global Strife. New Yorkers Can't Get a Cab.
summary: Resume Subscription. Inside the United Nations General Assembly this week, world leaders tackled the gravest issues facing humankind. Nuclear weapons. Tensions in the Persian Gulf. Fears of a climate apocalypse.

title: Fed's Kashkari: Monetary Policy Shouldn't Be Driven By Financial-Stability Concerns
summary: Minneapolis Fed leader believes such concerns should be dealt with via regulatory policy. Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari said that as the Fed weighs its next move on interest rates, it shouldn't be worried that lower rates will lead to financial instability.

title: Caltech Gets $750 Million Pledge for Sustainability, Climate Research
summary: Donation from owners of Wonderful Co. is the second largest ever to a U.S. university. The California Institute of Technology announced its largest-ever gift Thursday, a $750 million pledge from the family that owns Wonderful Co. aimed at enhancing and scaling research on environmental sustainability.

title: Natural-Gas Prices Slide After Storage Data
summary: Front-month natural-gas futures drop 3% to a three-week low. Natural-gas prices fell Thursday after government data showed U.S. stockpiles rose more than analysts expected.

title: Bank of Mexico Lowers Interest Rates Again
summary: Move comes on heels of Fed easing, slowing inflation. MEXICO CITY-The Bank of Mexico cut interest rates for a second consecutive month after inflation slowed to its 3% target amid economic stagnation.

title: Computer System Where Trump Document Was Reportedly Stashed Is Reserved for Biggest U.S. Secrets
summary: It is most tightly controlled of at least four different computer systems used by the National Security Council staff. WASHINGTON-A highly secure computer system where aides to President Trump reportedly stashed the details of his call with Ukraine's leader is so secretive that even top White House national-security aides don't have regular access, according to former officials familiar with its operation.

title: U.S. Sanctions Russian Firm For Alleged Fuel Sales To Syria
summary: Treasury says sales fueled regime bombing campaigns against Syria. WASHINGTON-The Trump administration imposed sanctions Thursday against a Moscow-based firm and five vessels the Treasury Department said shipped fuel to Syria used to support the Assad regime's bombing campaigns against civilians.

title: France Unveils Billions in Tax Cuts to Reset Pro-Business Plan
summary: President Emmanuel Macron faces a delicate balancing act as he tries to modernize France's economy without reigniting street violent protests. PARIS-The French government said it would reduce taxes on individuals and businesses by €10.2 billion as President Emmanuel Macron seeks to breathe new life into his drive to overhaul France's economy and stave off a revival of the yellow-vest protests that nearly doomed his agenda.

title: Germany's Commerzbank Names New CFO Amid Strategy Revamp
summary: Bettina Orlopp, the bank's current head of compliance, HR and legal will become finance chief. Commerzbank AG on Thursday named a new finance chief, a move that comes as Germany's second largest bank is revamping its strategy in response to challenging market conditions.

title: Imperial Brands Warns on Hit From U.S. Vaping Crackdown
summary: Company is the first global tobacco maker to lay out the impact from e-cigarettes fears. Imperial Brands PLC became the first global tobacco company to lay out the financial impact of the U.S. crackdown on vaping products, as the maker of Blu e-cigarettes warned its sales and profit would be lower than expected this year.

title: Yes Bernie Can!*
summary: The Sanders plan to abolish American billionaires.. "Billionaires should not exist," says Sen. Bernie Sanders (Socialist, Vt.). This week he sketched out a tax plan to ensure they won't, at least in the United States.

title: Arbitration Is Forced on Unwilling Consumers
summary: Arbitration is a useful tool but it has, like all human endeavors, been the subject of widespread abuse by claimants and businesses alike.. Regarding your editorial "The Lawyer Enrichment Act" (Sept. 21): As a professional arbitrator who makes a living arbitrating employment cases, I have pecuniary reasons for opposing the Forced Arbitration Injustice Repeal Act. I also disagree with the premise of the act: that claimants in arbitration aren't provided with a fair process that affords them appropriate compensation for legitimate wrongs.

title: Facebook's New Dating App: We're Not Feeling the Love
summary: Dating apps abound, but is the tech giant's new matchmaking feature a better way to become more than friends? The jury's out. IN THE NOT-SO-DISTANT future, it will no doubt be commonplace for a father to lean over and tell his kid, "It's true, Junior, I knew she was the one as soon as I swiped right."

title: Woke History: Formula for National Demise
summary: A truly repressive and unjust regime in Russia or China doesn't even have to collude with America's progressive educators to undermine its greatest enemy.. Regarding "Notable & Quotable: California" (Sept. 18): John Murawski reported on RealClearInvestigations.com how "Woke History Is Making Big Inroads in America's High Schools." High-school students in California learn how to carry out a campaign for social justice and then pay it forward by passing their social-justice message along to middle-school students. Social-justice words embedded in the minds of impressionable students include: oppression, toxic masculinity, heteronormativity, dehumanizing and genocide.

title: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina CEO Resigns
summary: Chief Operating Officer Gerald Petkau will be interim CEO. Blue Cross and Blue Shield of North Carolina said its board requested and received the resignation of Chief Executive Patrick Conway in the wake of fallout from an allegedly alcohol-related highway collision.

title: M.B.A.s Still Have Their Virtues for Many
summary: Helping people become better managers benefits our whole society.. Regarding Andy Kessler's "Is an M.B.A. Still Worth It?" (Inside View, Sept. 23): This is a question I deal with every day. I admit a bias. For nearly 30 years I've been in and out of the M.B.A. classroom as a student or teacher, and my perspective is different from Mr. Kessler's.

title: Fay Vincent Reminds Me Of Teachers I Should Thank
summary: During their classroom tenures many teachers have spawned a huge variety of life's joys and careers for their students.. Thanks to Fay Vincent for "I Should Have Thanked My Teachers" (op-ed, Sept. 23). During their classroom tenures many teachers have spawned a huge variety of life's joys and careers for their students. On my library shelf is a copy of "A Midsummer Night's Dream" inscribed "To Little Ursula" in 1915 from Miss Dougherty of the North Bennet Street School in Boston after the 10-year-old, my mother, had played the role of Titania in the school's presentation. My 30 years in the classroom were influenced by that event, while my four children's careers have followed similar paths. Unfortunately, Shakespeare has been deleted from many curricula because it is "too difficult for students to read and understand." No, it is too difficult for many current teachers and, of course, is based on Western theology, a giant "forbidden" in many schools and universities.

title: New York State Sues Dunkin' Over Hacked Accounts
summary: Coffee chain is accused of not informing nearly 20,000 customers that their accounts were attacked. The New York attorney general sued Dunkin' Brands Inc. for not notifying nearly 20,000 customers whose accounts on the coffee chain's website and mobile app were allegedly compromised in 2015.

title: PG&E Bondholders Boost Proposed Investment in Bankrupt Utility to $29.2 Billion
summary: Elliott-led chapter 11 plan creates two trusts: one to compensate wildfire victims and the other to pay insurers. A group of PG&E Corp. bondholders looking to take control of the business say they are willing to invest $29.2 billion into the bankrupt power company, an increase of about $800 million from their earlier proposal.

title: Port Authority Raises Tolls on Hudson River Bridges and Tunnels
summary: Toll for N.Y.-N.J. bridge and tunnels is set to rise to $13.75 peak and $11.75 off-peak with E-ZPass; cash toll will rise to $16. Crossing the Hudson River between New Jersey and New York is set to become costlier after the bistate agency that controls bridges, tunnels and the PATH rail system raised tolls and fares.

title: Vaping-Related Lung Illnesses Rise 52%, CDC Says
summary: Health authorities continue to urge people to stop using electronic cigarettes and other vaping devices. The number of confirmed or probable cases of vaping-related illness has risen to 805 across 46 states and one U.S. territory, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Thursday, as health authorities urge people to stop using electronic cigarettes and other vaping devices while it investigates a rash of illnesses and deaths linked to the products.

title: Ericsson Sets Aside $1.23 Billion for Foreign Bribery Settlement, Possible Monitor
summary: Swedish telecom equipment maker says resolution of criminal and civil probes by U.S. authorities still being finalized. The chief executive of Ericsson AB said Thursday that he regretted the company had not responded earlier to an inquiry by the Securities and Exchange Commission that resulted in the Swedish telecommunications-equipment maker reserving 12 billion Swedish kronor ($1.23 billion) in its third-quarter financials to cover fines and costs associated with foreign bribery violations.

title: Hong Kong Leader Unbowed by Anger at Rare Public Forum
summary: Carrie Lam holds public meeting as part of a dialogue strategy to end unrest, but doesn't announce measures sought by demonstrators. HONG KONG-Days before China celebrates 70 years of Communist rule, Hong Kong's leader held a public meeting with citizens to try to defuse tensions after months of antigovernment protests, but signaled little inclination to accede to demonstrators' demands.

title: Afghan Leader Seeks New Term, but Fears of Violence, Fraud Mar Path
summary: Halt to U.S.-Taliban negotiations boosts President Ashraf Ghani's campaign, but insurgents' threat and dissatisfaction with process could blunt turnout. KABUL-The two items that topped Afghan President Ashraf Ghani's political wish list for 2019 were ensuring the U.S. didn't push him aside in the country's peace process and winning another five-year term in office.

title: Managing ESG Risks Involves Looking Beyond the Quarter, Zurich CEO Says
summary: Mario Greco stresses the importance of having a long-term viewpoint when dealing with environmental, social and governance issues. After taking the helm of Zurich Insurance Group AG three years ago, Mario Greco put in place a plan to improve profitability, cutting costs and realigning business units.

title: Iran's Rouhani Says British Vessel Will Be Freed
summary: Iranian president says he open to discuss non-nuclear issues with U.S. if sanctions lifted. NEW YORK-Iranian President Hassan Rouhani said Thursday he expects the British-flagged vessel the Stena Impero to be freed.

title: Ravioli for (Elegant) Dummies
summary: No crimping or messing around with flour required. This recipe for loose ravioli with a lemony ricotta-mushroom filling makes a sumptuous meal in 20 minutes. "We've released these ravioli from their rigorous forms," said Christopher Hirsheimer of the third Slow Food Fast recipe she created with Melissa Hamilton. In their many collaborations-magazine features, cookbooks, their new restaurant in Milford, N.J.-the chefs have honed a shared style that's classic but never persnickety.

title: The Dish All Your Dinner Guests Will Be Fighting Over
summary: The crisp, craveable rice called tahdig inspires ferocious passion (and competition) in Iran and beyond. Here are all the tips you need to master this crowd-pleasing showpiece, plus three delicious recipes. GROWING UP in Iran, chef Hoss Zaré so coveted tahdig, the crisped layer of rice from the bottom of the pot, that he would make a game of hiding it in the kitchen. "I'd say, 'It's burned, you can't have it,' " he confessed. "I was just trying to keep it from my brothers so I could have more."

title: How to Eat Better Chicken and Also Save Money
summary: Skip the boneless, skinless breasts, buy the whole bird and butcher it yourself. It's economical, enlightening and, honestly, so easy. Here's how. AT THE TWO Hudson & Charles butcher shops in Manhattan, trainees begin with chicken. Breaking down a bird is an easy, economical, lost-to-time skill. "Why are people paying the same price for two boneless, skinless breasts when they can get the whole bird?" said co-owner J. Fox. A single chicken yields breasts, thighs, drumsticks, wings and soup bones.

title: Senate Confirms Eugene Scalia as Labor Secretary
summary: Son of Justice Antonin Scalia built a practice over past decade challenging Obama-era regulations. WASHINGTON-The Senate confirmed Eugene Scalia as Labor secretary on Thursday, installing a well-known corporate attorney at a department that handles a range of workplace matters

title: Father in College-Admissions Case Sentenced to Four Months in Prison
summary: 'What makes your children entitled to a side door?' judge asks as she sentences Los Angeles businessman. BOSTON-A Los Angeles father who paid $400,000 to get his son into Georgetown University as a phony tennis recruit was sentenced to four months in prison, with the judge chastising him for buying a slot that shut out a deserving student.

title: The Origins of 'Impeach': From Ensnared Feet to Accusations of High Crimes
summary: The term's long evolution has involved many rival meanings, and now it's often taken to mean not just 'investigate' but 'convict'. "You'll never guess our top search right now," teased Merriam-Webster's Twitter account on Tuesday evening. The word driving look-ups in the online dictionary was "impeach"-unsurprising given that this was soon after Speaker Nancy Pelosi's announcement that the House of Representatives would be pursuing an official impeachment inquiry of President Trump. Merriam-Webster reported its search rate for "impeach" jumped by a factor of 36.

title: Can a Grown Woman Wear Goth Fashion?

The dynasty had no age-because it never actually existed.

title: The Veneers Marketed as Custom Suits for Your Teeth
summary: This dentist-ceramicist team is peddling bespoke teeth so customized, they're in-demand from Brazil to Dubai. When the elevator opens into the New York office of Apa Rosenthal, there's a brief, "Am I in the right place?" moment. Machinery whirls in an enclosed glass laboratory-cum-artists' studio, loud rock music plays, and employees who seem to be dressed more for dinner at Le Bilboquet than for a day at work move about the bright white space. But then, Ahh, or perhaps, Eww. The eye is drawn to an iPad, on which a photo of a rather gruesome-looking set of teeth is displayed, and it's clear that, yes, this is a dentist's office. It is sleek, with pale gray marble flooring and white furniture backlit by purple lighting. This office gleams like a perfect smile.
